title: Karahi Chicken with Roasted Tomato–Green Chilli Salsa — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 210°C (fan 190°C). Roast tomatoes 12–15 minutes until blistered.
Brown chicken in a hot pan 4 minutes per side.
Add ginger, garlic and spices; cook 1 minute.
Stir in tomato purée and 80 ml water; simmer 6–8 minutes.
Add chickpeas and broccoli; cover and cook 6–7 minutes until tender.
Blend roasted tomatoes with chilli and lemon; spoon over and finish with coriander.
plating: Serve in a shallow bowl: sauce and chickpeas first, chicken on top, broccoli to one side, salsa over the crown.
swaps: Swap chickpeas for cooked brown lentils.
optional_finishes: Pickled red onions as a sharp condiment
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon keeps chilli clean.

title: Sindhi-Style Prawn Masala with Charred Okra — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Toss okra with ½ tsp oil; roast 12–14 minutes until charred.
Cook onion 6–7 minutes until golden; add ginger and garlic 45 seconds.
Add spices; cook 45 seconds, then add tomatoes and simmer 8 minutes.
Add prawns and cook 3–4 minutes until pink and just firm.
Stir in garam masala and fold in charred okra.
Finish with lemon juice and coriander.
plating: Plate sauce in a wide bowl, prawns centred, okra scattered over, coriander to finish.
swaps: Use firm white fish pieces instead of prawns.
optional_finishes: A spoon of mango pickle on the side
hydrationTip: Sparkling water suits chilli and seafood.

title: Peshawari Chappal Kebab with Roasted Peppers — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 220°C (fan 200°C). Roast peppers with ½ tsp oil 18–20 minutes.
Mix mince with onion, chilli, egg, oat bran and spices; form 4 flat kebabs.
Bake kebabs 12–14 minutes, turning once, until browned and cooked through.
Rest 3 minutes; season peppers.
Serve kebabs with peppers.
Finish with lemon and coriander.
plating: Peppers as a base, kebabs leaned on top; finish with coriander.
swaps: Swap beef for lamb mince.
optional_finishes: Pickled onions.
hydrationTip: Sparkling water cuts richness.

title: Balochi Lamb Sajji with Roasted Roots & Herb Salad — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 200°C (fan 180°C). Roast carrots and courgettes with ½ tsp oil 20 minutes.
Season lamb with spices and lemon; sear 2 minutes per side.
Roast lamb 10–12 minutes; rest 8 minutes.
Toss cucumber with herbs and vinegar.
Slice lamb and plate.
Finish with extra lemon.
plating: Roasted veg in a tight stack, lamb fanned, herb salad alongside.
swaps: Use beef rump instead of lamb.
optional_finishes: A spoon of yoghurt if desired.
hydrationTip: Still water with lemon keeps peppery spice clean.

title: Bengali Mustard Fish with Wilted Greens — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 210°C (fan 190°C). Coat cod with mustard, turmeric and lemon.
Roast cod 12–14 minutes until just flaking.
Steam beans 5–6 minutes; add greens for final 2 minutes.
Toast mustard seeds 30 seconds.
Plate fish on greens and beans.
Finish with toasted seeds and lemon.
plating: Greens as a base, cod on top, mustard seeds scattered for texture.
swaps: Use trout instead of cod.
optional_finishes: Pickled radish.
hydrationTip: Still water keeps mustard bright.

title: Quetta-Style Beef Nihari (Light) with Spinach — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 150°C (fan 130°C). Brown beef 6–7 minutes; add onion 8 minutes.
Add ginger, garlic and spices 1 minute.
Add stock, cover and braise 2½ hours until tender.
Whisk in oat bran; simmer 5 minutes to thicken.
Stir in spinach 2 minutes.
Rest 5 minutes before serving.
plating: Serve glossy stew in a bowl, spinach folded through, coriander and lemon to finish.
swaps: Use lamb shoulder instead of beef.
optional_finishes: Pickled ginger.
hydrationTip: Warm water with lemon is gentle alongside slow spice.

title: Masoor Dal with Crispy Garlic & Lemon — Foodie Fuel
method: Fry garlic in 2 tsp oil 2–3 minutes; lift out.
Toast cumin seeds 30 seconds; add onion 6–7 minutes.
Add turmeric; stir 30 seconds.
Add lentils and stock; simmer 18–20 minutes until creamy.
Stir in spinach 2 minutes; finish with lemon.
Top with crispy garlic and chilli flakes.
plating: Smooth dal in a bowl; crown with crispy garlic and lemon zest.
swaps: Add a poached egg for extra protein.
optional_finishes: Fermented chilli sauce (optional).
hydrationTip: Warm water with lemon is gentle alongside lentils.

title: Hunza Trout with Apricot–Mustard Glaze, Almonds & Charred Greens — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 210°C (fan 190°C). Roast trout 12–14 minutes.
Char greens in a pan 4–5 minutes.
Warm apricots with 2 tbsp water 2 minutes; stir in mustard and lemon.
Spoon glaze over trout.
Scatter almonds.
Serve with greens.
plating: Twist greens, place trout, spoon glaze, scatter almonds.
swaps: Use salmon if preferred.
optional_finishes: Pickled shallots.
hydrationTip: Still water keeps flavours clear.

title: Lahori Chicken Seekh Kebab with Roasted Aubergine & Herb Salad — Foodie Fuel
method: Heat oven to 210°C (fan 190°C).
Cook onion 6–7 minutes until soft and golden.
Add ginger, garlic and spices; cook 45 seconds until fragrant.
Add tomatoes and 100 ml water; simmer 8–10 minutes to thicken.
Add protein and cook until done (chicken 14–16 minutes, mince 10–12 minutes, fish 8–10 minutes, prawns 3–4 minutes).
Add vegetables and legumes; cook 6–7 minutes. Finish with lemon and coriander.
plating: Serve in a warm bowl: sauce base, protein centred, vegetables to one side; finish with coriander and lemon zest.
swaps: Swap legumes (chickpeas ↔ lentils) to vary texture.
optional_finishes: Add pickled onions or fermented chilli as an optional condiment.
hydrationTip: Still or sparkling water with lemon.

method: Heat a wide pan on medium heat.
